thread.title: Terrorist killed in Jammu and Kashmir’s Rajouri
thread.title_full: Terrorist killed in Jammu and Kashmir’s Rajouri

author: FE Online
title: Terrorist killed in Jammu and Kashmir’s Rajouri
text:
Terrorist killed in Jammu and Kashmir’s Rajouri Terrorist killed in Jammu and Kashmir’s Rajouri A terrorist was killed by security forces in Keri Sector of Rajouri in Jammu and Kashmir. By: FE Online | New Delhi | Updated: February 21, 2017 9:12 AM A terrorist was killed by security forces in Keri Sector of Rajouri in Jammu and Kashmir. (Source: IE) 
Kashmir Encounter: A terrorist was killed by security forces in Keri Sector of Rajouri in Jammu and Kashmir. A gunfight ensued between BSF 163 Battalion and terrorists. Two terrorists manged to flee the spot but one terrorist was annihilated, according to a report. It has been learned that terrorists opened fire at BSF after they foiled an infiltration bid along the International Border. AK-47 rifle was recovered from the spot. 
An unidentified militant was killed while five security force personnel were injured in an ongoing encounter in north Kashmir’s Bandipora district a few days ago. The militant was killed in the encounter in Parray Mohalla in Hajin area of the district. The injured security force personnel have been rushed to a hospital, a police official said. 
Security forces launched a cordon and search operation in the area this morning following specific intelligence inputs about presence of militants in the area. 
While the forces were conducting the search operation, the hiding militants fired upon them, triggering the encounter, the official said. 
Two army jawans and four militants were killed in an encounter early this morning in Frisal area of south Kashmir’s Kulgam district. 
Acting on a tip-off by police, army cordoned off a village in Kulgam, 60 km from here. 
Three other militants, believed to be severely injured during the gunfight, managed to escape. Hunt is on to nab them, sources said. 
An encounter broke out this morning in Frisal area after security forces launched the cordon and search operation, a police official said, adding the operation was still on. 
A Lashkar-e-Toiba militant was today killed while a policeman was injured in an encounter in Bandipora district of north Kashmir. 
On specific intelligence input about presence of militants in Hajin area of Bandipora, security forces launched a cordon and search operation, a police official said. 
He said during the search operation, the hiding militants fired upon the forces, which was retaliated in which a militant was killed. 
A police constable was also injured in the gunfight, the official said, adding he has been referred to a hospital here. 
The militant belonged to LeT outfit, the official said. 
He said some miscreants pelted stones on the security forces near the encounter site. Please Wait while comments are loading...
